2.text: How long will you afflict my soul and wear me down with words?

3.text: So, ten times you confound me and are not ashamed to oppress me.

4.text: Now, of course, if I have been ignorant, my ignorance will be with me.

5.text: But you have risen up against me, and you accuse me to my disgrace.

6.text: At least now you should understand that God has not afflicted me with a balanced judgment, though he has encompassed me with his scourges.

7.text: Behold, I will cry out, enduring violence, and no one will hear. I will announce loudly, but there is no one who may judge.

8.text: He has hemmed in my path, and I cannot pass; he has added darkness to my difficult path.

9.text: He has plundered me of my glory, and he has stolen the crown from my head.

10.text: He has destroyed me on every side, and I am lost, and, like an uprooted tree, he has taken away my hope.

11.text: His fury has raged against me, and in this way he has treated me like his enemy.

12.text: His troops have gathered together, and they have made their way to me, and they have besieged my tabernacle all around.

13.text: He has put my brothers far from me, and my friends have withdrawn from me like strangers.

14.text: My kinsmen have forsaken me, and those who knew me, have forgotten me.

15.text: The inhabitants of my house and my maidservants treat me just as if I were a stranger, and I have been like an sojourner in their eyes.

16.text: I called my servant, and he did not respond; I pleaded with him with my own mouth.

17.text: My wife has shuddered at my breath, and I have begged the sons of my loins.

18.text: Even the foolish have looked down on me, and, when I withdrew from them, they spoke ill of me.

19.text: Those who were sometime my counselors, treat me like an abomination; and he whom I valued the most has turned against me.

20.text: Since my flesh has been consumed, my bone adheres to my skin, and only my lips have been left around my teeth.

21.text: Have mercy on me, have compassion on me, at least you my friends, because the hand of the Lord has touched me.

22.text: Why do you pursue me just as God does, and satiate yourselves with my flesh?

23.text: Who will grant to me that my words may be written down? Who will grant to me that they may be inscribed in a book,

24.text: with an iron pen and a plate of lead, or else be carved in stone?

25.text: For I know that my Redeemer lives, and on the last day I will rise out of the earth.

26.text: And I will be enveloped again with my skin, and in my flesh I will see my God.

27.text: It is he whom I myself will see, and he whom my eyes will behold, and no other. This, my hope, has taken rest in my bosom.

28.text: Why then do you now say: “Let us pursue him, and let us find a basis to speak against him?”

29.text: So then, flee from the face of the sword, for the sword is the avenger of iniquities; but know this: there is to be a judgment.
